intro: Daucus stenopterus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved carrot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are not typically cultivated for food but are sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine. Daucus stenopterus thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
